text: This place is really very huge with other building connected thru underground tunnel of Mrt station and there's so many offices and shops to go around and you can get lost, so you need to take note of directions board overhead and you can see part of marina bay sands and the hotels, thanks

The best place for car scene. Automotive lovers, do visit Millenia Walk on weekends, you sure will find at least 1-2 sports car there !
It’s a common place for car owners to gather and meet for lunch/coffee.
The mall is aesthetic. It has Great food, cafe, and it’s very accessible if you want to cross to Marina Square or Suntec City via shelter walkway. Also this place is packed yearly during F1, whereby F1 fans will come here to see and have a chance to meet their fellow racers and also one of the nearest exit to walk to the F1 zones.

They have Japanese restaurants.  Japanese super market medi -ya , furniture store Harvey Norman , exercise spin studio.

Harvey Norman is like 3 levels .
Accessible from surrounding hotels like Ritz Carlton , mandarin oriental , Park royal marina , Pan pacific .

Millennia Walk offers a delightful dining experience with its variety of food options that are sure to please any palate. Its central location in the city is so convenient, allowing for easy albeit sometimes expensive parking right outside the mall. And the frequent sight of beautiful cars parked adds a touch of excitement to every visit!

I recently visited a shopping mall, and it was a fantastic experience. The store was clean and spacious, with a wide range of products well displayed. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful, providing valuable information and advice on products. Additionally, I was pleased to find high-quality items at reasonable prices. The checkout process was smooth and efficient. Overall, it was a highly satisfying shopping experience, and I look forward to visiting again in the future.
